commit_message:
Add devmode.sh to wrap full-deploy.sh

This new script can be used by developer to create a full testing
environment from the master-tripleo-ci images, optionally including
changes either from a previous Zuul run or from Jenkins.

Change-Id: Ifc12fdb50bd86a0f7af1ad2c15fca7033be91e85
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/45/382845/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash : ${GATE:=1} : ${WORKSPACE:=$HOME/.quickstart} : ${RELEASE:=master-tripleo-ci} : ${CONFIG:=minimal} : ${BUILD_SYS:=delorean} interactive=0 reproducer_type=gerrit usage () { echo "Usage: $0 [options] virthost" echo "" echo "Options:" echo " -c, --config <type>" echo " specify the node configuration (default=$OPT_CONFIG)" echo " -n, --no-gate do not ask for gating a commit when gating" echo " variables are missing (default is gating)" echo " -w, --working-dir <dir>" echo " directory where the virtualenv, inventory files, etc." echo " are created (default=$WORKSPACE)" echo " -h, --help print this help and exit" echo " virthost target machine used for deployment, required argument" } zuul-gate () { if [[ -z "$ZUUL_HOST" ]]; then interactive=1 echo "Which Zuul host to use? (default=review.openstack.org)" read -p "ZUUL_HOST=" ZUUL_HOST ZUUL_HOST=${ZUUL_HOST:-"review.openstack.org"} echo "" fi ZUUL_HOST=${ZUUL_HOST:-"review.openstack.org"} if [[ -z "$ZUUL_CHANGES" ]]; then interactive=1 echo "Specify ZUUL_CHANGES variable from logs/reproduce.sh" read -p "ZUUL_CHANGES=" ZUUL_CHANGES echo "" fi export ZUUL_{HOST,CHANGES} } gerrit-gate () { if [[ -z "$GERRIT_HOST" ]]; then interactive=1 echo "Which Gerrit host to use? (default=review.openstack.org)" read -p "GERRIT_HOST=" GERRIT_HOST GERRIT_HOST=${GERRIT_HOST:-"review.openstack.org"} echo "" fi if [[ -z "$GERRIT_BRANCH" ]]; then interactive=1 echo "Which branch is the patch on? (default=master)" read -p "GERRIT_BRANCH=" GERRIT_BRANCH GERRIT_BRANCH=${GERRIT_BRANCH:-master} echo "" fi if [[ -z "$GERRIT_CHANGE_ID" ]]; then interactive=1 echo "What is the Change-Id? Can be found in the commit message." echo "Note: all \"Depends-On:\" changes are going to be built as well." read -p "GERRIT_CHANGE_ID=" GERRIT_CHANGE_ID echo "" fi if [[ -z "$GERRIT_PATCHSET_REVISION" ]]; then interactive=1 echo "What is the git commit hash of the patchset?" echo "It can be found in the Commit field on Gerrit" read -p "GERRIT_PATCHSET_REVISION=" GERRIT_PATCHSET_REVISION echo "" fi export GERRIT_{HOST,BRANCH,CHANGE_ID,PATCHSET_REVISION} } interactive-gate () { if [[ -z $VIRTHOST ]]; then interactive=1 echo "Please enter the host to use. You need to be able to ssh as root without" echo "password with your current user (i.e. ssh root@\$VIRTHOST must succeed)" echo "Note: If you set this variable before the script starts this won't be asked" read -p "VIRTHOST=" VIRTHOST fi if [[ -z $WORKSPACE ]]; then interactive=1 echo "Specify the a workspace directory. Run time files will be put here." echo "(default=$HOME/.quickstart)" read -p "WORKSPACE=" WORKSPACE WORKSPACE=${WORKSPACE:-"$HOME/.quickstart"} fi if [[ -n "$ZUUL_HOST" ]]; then reproducer_type=zuul fi if [[ -z "$ZUUL_HOST" && -z "$GERRIT_HOST" ]]; then interactive=1 echo "Do you want to reproduce an environment from an upstream CI Zuul job" echo "or use a Gerrit change? (default=gerrit)" read -p "[zuul/GERRIT] " reproducer_type echo "" fi if [[ $reproducer_type = 'zuul' ]]; then zuul-gate else gerrit-gate fi if [[ "$interactive" = "1" ]]; then echo "Check if these values are correct:" else echo "Running with the following variables:" fi echo "" if [[ $reproducer_type = 'zuul' ]]; then echo "ZUUL_HOST=$ZUUL_HOST" echo "ZUUL_CHANGES=$ZUUL_CHANGES" echo "export VIRTHOST WORKSPACE ZUUL_{HOST,CHANGES}" else echo "GERRIT_HOST=$GERRIT_HOST" echo "GERRIT_BRANCH=$GERRIT_BRANCH" echo "GERRIT_CHANGE_ID=$GERRIT_CHANGE_ID" echo "GERRIT_PATCHSET_REVISION=$GERRIT_PATCHSET_REVISION" echo "export GERRIT_{HOST,BRANCH,CHANGE_ID,PATCHSET_REVISION}" fi echo "" if [[ "$interactive" = "1" ]]; then echo "Note: You can re-run this script non-interactively by pasting" echo "the lines above to the console before rerunning the script." echo "Hit ENTER to continue, or CTRL-C to exit" read fi } while [ "x$1" != "x" ]; do case "$1" in --working-dir|-w) WORKSPACE=$(realpath $2) shift ;; --config|-c) CONFIG=$2 shift ;; --no-gate|-n) GATE=0 ;; --help|-h) usage exit ;; --) shift break ;; -*) echo "ERROR: unknown option: $1" >&2 usage >&2 exit 2 ;; *) break ;; esac shift done pushd $(dirname ${BASH_SOURCE[0]:-$0}) # variables needed for the CI script export VIRTHOST=$1 export WORKSPACE if [ "$GATE" = "1" ]; then interactive-gate JOB_TYPE=dlrn-gate else JOB_TYPE=periodic fi bash ci-scripts/full-deploy.sh $RELEASE $BUILD_SYS $CONFIG $JOB_TYPE popd

subject: Add alt text for badges
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-01 16:56:57.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs/commit/b6c8778ac1b3a609f7f19d101c256198257a01af', 'message': "Add alt text for badges

The RST image directive takes an alt parameter that's used to supply an
alt attribute for the HTML image element that's generated during RST
to HTML conversion.  The alt text is useful for accessibility purposes
and is also displayed if the image source is unavailable when the HTML
is generated.  Because of the latter point, we can't rely on the
accessibility features of the SVG image, we need to maintain some info
here in the README.rst file.

Change-Id: I0dd53bf1f42a81a697c3b8201d01c5f045f16f51
"}]
commit_message:
Add alt text for badges

The RST image directive takes an alt parameter that's used to supply an
alt attribute for the HTML image element that's generated during RST
to HTML conversion.  The alt text is useful for accessibility purposes
and is also displayed if the image source is unavailable when the HTML
is generated.  Because of the latter point, we can't rely on the
accessibility features of the SVG image, we need to maintain some info
here in the README.rst file.

Change-Id: I0dd53bf1f42a81a697c3b8201d01c5f045f16f51

commit_message:
Increase ovsdb timeout default value.

Increase the default value for the ovsdb timeout for OVN.  We hit this
timeout under heavy load testing.  There doesn't seem to be any harm in
letting things just take longer, so increase this timeout to 3 minutes
by default.

Change-Id: I4713c986c5f1d19533c841cdfeaea822c15336dc
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/102a51410f6eb091319c40c2947ac0e2

Change-Id: Iabc6a052d1ee38f5288b35eac3e79ab865206e1e

commit_message:
Fix the install guide bug

The WSGIScriptAlias in ``/etc/apache2/sites-available/ceilometer.conf``
shoule be ``/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/ceilometer/api/app.wsgi``

Closes-Bug: #1644972

Change-Id: Id795520b1330114243c6045162abad6d4d1f1ae8
Signed-off-by: liyuenan <liyuenan@huawei.com>

Remove unused publish jobs from astara

The astara repos have docs.o.o publishing defined but do not use them.
Remove it - especially since astara is not an official project anymore.

commit_message:
Remove unused jobs propose-app-catalog-update

This job is not used at all, remove it - especially since we do not want
these kind of proposal jobs anymore.

Remoe also the script that it uses.

Change-Id: I9a4d234a2a6399fdfbf82c6ddeeeb9728d4dae3f

deleted_lines: #!/bin/bash -xe # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. source /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/common.sh PROJECT="openstack/app-catalog" BRANCH="proposals" INITIAL_COMMIT_MSG="Detect dead links" TOPIC="detect-dead-links" USERNAME="proposal-bot" SUCCESS=0 setup_git # Function setup_commit_message will set CHANGE_ID if a change # exists and will always set COMMIT_MSG. setup_commit_message $PROJECT $USERNAME $BRANCH $TOPIC "$INITIAL_COMMIT_MSG" git review -s python /usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts/check_app_catalog_yaml.py if ! git diff --stat --exit-code HEAD ; then # Commit and review git_args="-a -F-" git commit $git_args <<EOF $COMMIT_MSG EOF # Do error checking manually to ignore one class of failure. set +e OUTPUT=$(git review -t $TOPIC) RET=$? [[ "$RET" -eq "0" || "$OUTPUT" =~ "no new changes" || "$OUTPUT" =~ "no changes made" ]] SUCCESS=$? fi exit $SUCCESS

subject: Allow "version" to be within workflow names in workbooks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-01 10:12:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/2bf4b8c32a7d4f1c493a2fb5a1172b2492c791a5', 'message': 'Allow "version" to be within workflow names in workbooks

There were two bugs in the schema validation for Mistral workflow names
within Workbooks. The goal in this part of the validation is to detect the
version property and assign it the enum type and then assin all other
single word properties to use the workflow/action schemas.

1. Detecting version properties. The code before this patch has the
following line.

    "version": {"enum": ["2.0", 2.0]},

This looked safe, but "version" is actually a regular expression.
Meaning that it will match any string containging "version". Adding ^ at the
start and $ at the end means that it matches a string from the start to the
end and is exactly "version".

2. Detecting workflows/actions. The current regular expression was

    "^(?!version)\w+$": _action_schema

This worked in most cases. It basically means "Any word that doesn't
start with version". So this worked, but was incorrect for workflows
called "versionworkflow" - it didn't match this when it should have.
Adding a ?: to create a non-capturing portion of the regular expression
solved this issue.

Any workflows that have a name that doesn't match this regular
expression. Such as those with a space "my worflow" were previously
ignored before this patch. The addition of additionalProperties: False
in the schema shows users an error if they use an invalid workflow name.

Closes-Bug: #1645354
Change-Id: Ib2b406a05cf15b41be075f886de77509a9da8535

commit_message:
Allow "version" to be within workflow names in workbooks

There were two bugs in the schema validation for Mistral workflow names
within Workbooks. The goal in this part of the validation is to detect the
version property and assign it the enum type and then assin all other
single word properties to use the workflow/action schemas.

1. Detecting version properties. The code before this patch has the
following line.

    "version": {"enum": ["2.0", 2.0]},

This looked safe, but "version" is actually a regular expression.
Meaning that it will match any string containging "version". Adding ^ at the
start and $ at the end means that it matches a string from the start to the
end and is exactly "version".

2. Detecting workflows/actions. The current regular expression was

    "^(?!version)\w+$": _action_schema

This worked in most cases. It basically means "Any word that doesn't
start with version". So this worked, but was incorrect for workflows
called "versionworkflow" - it didn't match this when it should have.
Using ?: to create a non-capturing portion of the regular expression
solved this issue.

Any workflows that have a name that doesn't match this regular
expression. Such as those with a space (like "my worflow") were silently
ignored before this patch. The addition of additionalProperties: False
in the schema shows users an error if they use an invalid workflow name.

Closes-Bug: #1645354
Change-Id: Ib2b406a05cf15b41be075f886de77509a9da8535

Enable Full Tempest Test For Telemetry Services

Change-Id: I5920c93f3babb22d68e61adc262ecef6446d8472
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/telemetry-specs refs/changes/19/311619/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =============================================== Enable Full Tempest Test For Telemetry Services =============================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/place-hold https://blueprints.launchpad.net/aodh/+spec/place-hold Problem description =================== We have been talking about tempest for a so long time, but progress is really slow. In Mitaka we finally shift the code from tempest to our own repositories which is good but we should not satisfy about current situation. Image that we Telemetry Service supports all OpenStack core projects and many projects in Big Tent, but only has 5 tempest test cases, and 1 even marked as skipped. We should start to do something before too late. Proposed change =============== Write tempest test code to cover: Ceilometer: * all notifications, mentioned in event_definitions.yaml and meters.yaml, of core projects which are enabled in ci gate tempest job * the rest of them, for such case, we need infra team's support and resources, but I think it is ok to do so. * all pollsters for core projects enabled in ci gate * the rest of them Aodh: * threshold alarms * gnocchi alarms * event alarms Alternatives ------------ Keep it, we are good. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Pipeline impact --------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- They will be happy because we become solid now. Performance/Scalability Impacts ------------------------------- None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- New notifications and pollsters are required to write tempest code to verify it. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <zqfan> Other contributors: <None> Ongoing maintainer: <None> Work Items ---------- As mentioned above. Future lifecycle ================ None Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= The code itself. Documentation Impact ==================== None References ========== None

commit_message:
Monasca publisher for ceilometer

This spec outlines approach for integrating
Monasca as a ceilometer data collection backend.

blueprint monasca-backend

Change-Id: I3d09180814f8972171553124fec79bca5e5a7be5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/telemetry-specs refs/changes/06/249406/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Monasca as Ceilometer backend ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+spec/monasca-backend The goal of this blueprint is to integrate Monasca as a ceilometer data collection backend for ceilometer samples and events. Problem description =================== Ceilometer monitors and collects data from OpenStack via notifications sent from existing services or by polling the infrastructure. Ceilometer has historically had issues with scaling where Monasca is known to scale well. When consuming large scale data, ceilometer encounters bottleneck while republishing of samples to rabbitMQ, In large deployments, rabbitMQ clustering has some limitations around the 20M-mark load [1]; this can slow down the queue performance and impact other services relying on the queue. Batching of samples is an important feature to achieve high insert throughput. Most ceilometer backends do not support batching and the ones that do are for datapoints for the same meter, whereas in a cloud, samples arrive in random for disparate meters. Its important for the backend to support batching for cross-meter samples. Monasca is a highly scalable monitoring solution and exposes a REST API for metric and measurement processing. which stores them into Kafka. Kafka is known to be performant at much higher loads that RMQ can support. This allows for a different publishing rate from the storage rate in Ceilometer collector, thereby increasing performance and optimization at the distinct layers. By integrating Monasca as a ceilometer backend, ceilometer can leverage monasca ability to batch datapoints and bypass re-publishing to RMQ. It also allows for interesting possibilities for new use cases around metering and monitoring since Monasca is backend for monitoring metrics as well. Last but not the least, Monasca API also offers faster query response times and paging. Its found to be much faster than the ceilometer v2 API [2]. It offers an interesting option to consider integrating Monasca API as a ceilometer storage driver or as an alternative for the ceilometer v2 API. Proposed change =============== Integrate Monasca as publisher in ceilometer. A new publisher plugin needs to be implemented and will be enabled by entry_points and configured for metadata filtering, batching and failure retrying via conf. Metadata filtering is an important configuration for the publisher. It maps the resource metadata attributes for a meter that need to be preserved when the meter datapoint(sample) is published to Monasca. Metadata attributes that do not match in an incoming sample are discarded. The publisher plugin approach is preferred since it keep changes isolated from the main ceilometer tree and avoids the need of datapoints being re-published to RMQ after pipeline processing. Pipeline processing will not be affected by the publisher since Monasca-api is async with respect to data persistence in backend. The publisher can be enabled by including monasca:// as prefix for the publisher in a pipeline sink in the pipeline configuration file (pipeline.yaml) Alternatives ------------ Integrate Monasca as a ceilometer dispatcher. This also uses a plugin approach, but it requires samples to be published back to RMQ (ceilometer metering bus) and will not improve write performance. While it does make the overall design more conformant to current integrations of different backends in ceilometer, the impact it has on load performance does make it unattractive to consider. Data model impact ----------------- * It does not require any schema changes since backend is entirely Monasca. * For existing deployments, migration tasks need to be implemented to copy over the data to Monasca. REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- Monasca is a multi-tenant solution so tenant-level segregation of datapoints is enforced at all times. Pipeline impact --------------- Monasca publisher needs explicit configuration in pipeline as a valid publisher with the prefix: monasca:// for a pipeline sink. Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance/Scalability Impacts ------------------------------- * Monasca publisher can support much higher rates of message consumption. * Data retention policies will be supported and enforced by Monasca. Other deployer impact --------------------- * batch_mode, batch_count, batch_timeout, retry_interval, max_retries are some of the new configuration params that will be defined in a new section - monasca in ceilometer.conf. These however will have reasonable defaults. * publisher will already be enabled via setup entry_points, but not be used by default. pipeline.yaml will need to include this publisher. * new configuration file for metadata mappings will need to be copied over to /etc/ceilometer * This depends on python-monascaclient, so that package will need to be included in requirements.txt Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: rohit-jaiswal-3 Other contributors: TBD Ongoing maintainer: rohit-jaiswal-3 Work Items ---------- * Add a new client facade for monasca client in ceilometer - monasca_client.py to massage the calls made to monasca python bindings and handle common exceptions * Create a new configuration file - monasca_field_definitions.yaml under etc/ceilometer to enlist the metadata mappings for all ceilometer supported meters. * Add a new data filter module in ceilometer/publisher - monasca_data_filter.py that uses the above mapping configuration file to filter sample metadata. * Add a new publisher - monasca_publisher.py to ceilometer/publisher. * Add unit tests for monasca_client, monasca_data_filter and monasca_publisher. * Support monasca as a backend for ceilometer in devstack - Modify devstack plugin in ceilometer to set monasca configuration in ceilometer conf files and enable monasca in devstack[3]. Future lifecycle ================ * Support publishing events from Ceilometer to Monasca. * Add support for Monasca as a ceilometer storage driver. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Add unit tests for new publisher. Documentation Impact ==================== Document what metadata needs to be supported by Monasca for each ceilometer supported meter and configure the monasca field definitions file. References ========== [1] http://blogs.cisco.com/cloud/ceilometer-monasca-ceilosca [2] http://www.slideshare.net/FabioGiannetti/ceilosca [3] https://github.com/openstack/monasca-api/tree/master/devstack

commit_message:
don't setup cells if n-cpu isn't also running

create_cell requires n-api and at least one n-cpu up and running. If
we have a configuration where it is not guarunteed that there is an
n-cpu at the end of a devstack run we have to skip this step and make
the user run it manually later.

Change-Id: I2287ab29f3c1a7252271dcce81673ef365615296
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/93/406893/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if is_service_enabled n-cpu; then create_cell else # Some CI systems like Hyper-V build the control plane on # Linux, and join in non Linux Computes after setup. This # allows them to delay the processing until after their whole # environment is up. echo_summary "SKIPPING Cell setup because n-cpu is not enabled. You will have to do this manually before you have a working environment." fi

commit_message:
Write a couple of test cases together

In these test cases, use the same snapshot or volume,
they have many of the same code, so write them together.

Merge test_create_get_delete_snapshot_metadata and
test_update_snapshot_metadata together in
test_snapshot_metadata.py.

Merge test_create_get_delete_volume_metadata and
test_update_volume_metadata together in test_volume_metadata.py.

Also do self.***['id'] instead of create a new varible.

Change-Id: I8d9296f958e17d20a39a05800ac1808347d952bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/59/396159/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_create_get_updata_delete_snapshot_metadata(self): # Create metadata # Update metadata body = self.client.update_snapshot_metadata( self.snapshot_id, metadata=update)['metadata'] self.assertEqual(update, body) # Update metadata item for the snapshot body = self.client.update_snapshot_metadata_item( self.snapshot_id, "key3", metadata=update_item)['metadata'] body = self.client.show_snapshot_metadata( self.snapshot_id)['metadata'] self.assertEqual(expect, body) # Delete one item metadata of the snapshot body = self.client.delete_snapshot_metadata_item( self.snapshot_id, "key1")['metadata'] body = self.client.show_snapshot_metadata( self.snapshot_id)['metadata'] self.assertThat(body.items(), matchers.ContainsAll(expected.items())) self.assertNotIn("key1", body)
deleted_lines: def test_create_get_delete_snapshot_metadata(self): body = self.client.create_snapshot_metadata( self.snapshot_id, metadata)['metadata'] # Get the metadata of the snapshot body = self.client.show_snapshot_metadata( self.snapshot_id)['metadata'] self.assertThat(body.items(), matchers.ContainsAll(metadata.items())) # Delete one item metadata of the snapshot self.client.delete_snapshot_metadata_item( self.snapshot_id, "key1") body = self.client.show_snapshot_metadata( self.snapshot_id)['metadata'] self.assertThat(body.items(), matchers.ContainsAll(expected.items())) self.assertNotIn("key1", body) @test.idempotent_id('bd2363bc-de92-48a4-bc98-28943c6e4be1') def test_update_snapshot_metadata(self): # Update metadata for the snapshot metadata = {"key1": "value1", "key2": "value2", "key3": "value3"} # Create metadata for the snapshot body = self.client.create_snapshot_metadata( self.snapshot_id, metadata)['metadata'] # Get the metadata of the snapshot body = self.client.show_snapshot_metadata( self.snapshot_id)['metadata'] self.assertThat(body.items(), matchers.ContainsAll(metadata.items())) # Update metadata item body = self.client.update_snapshot_metadata( self.snapshot_id, metadata=update)['metadata'] # Get the metadata of the snapshot body = self.client.show_snapshot_metadata( self.snapshot_id)['metadata'] self.assertEqual(update, body) @test.idempotent_id('e8ff85c5-8f97-477f-806a-3ac364a949ed') def test_update_snapshot_metadata_item(self): # Update metadata item for the snapshot metadata = {"key1": "value1", "key2": "value2", "key3": "value3"} # Create metadata for the snapshot # Update metadata item body = self.client.update_snapshot_metadata_item( self.snapshot_id, "key3", meta=update_item)['meta'] # Get the metadata of the snapshot self.assertThat(body.items(), matchers.ContainsAll(expect.items()))

commit_message:
Fixes issues with special characters in password.

Post install tasks in os_ironic role don't quote password
values, having shell special characters in password is
resulting in failed runs.

Closes-Bug: 1647248
Change-Id: If7fefb112ffdee8d9ee162b1f0bc0bbe10528e3e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ironic refs/changes/82/406682/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

When uuid is a value of uuid.uuid4(), the following code is wrong:

commit_message:
Fix confusion of string and uuid

When uuid is a value of uuid.uuid4(), the following code is wrong:
    self.uuid in f.readline()
    os.path.join(conf_dir, uuid)
So we should let uuid formatted into a string before using it.

Change-Id: I1b357415e2f056c8fede498c13a8935ceb9384a3
Partial-Bug: #1645078
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/06/403406/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Remove static indexing from repo build process

The repo server has autoindexing enabled, so the tasks
to enumerate the contents of the folder and to produce
a static index file are unnecessary.

This patch removes the tasks and ensures that the files
in an existing repository are also removed to cater for
upgrades.

Change-Id: Ic2bb537f331d14a4ddfefa5ea9ec785d0fce3835
(cherry picked from commit 34b0802a887d12da0cc98f18cc066509860b1250)

commit_message:
Add wrapper for decimal.Decimal objects in json.dumps()

Change-Id: I42b05af44c6b41ef15039a3e71026836c9e0ae94
Closes-bug: 1647346
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/42/406942/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import decimalclass DecimalJSONEncoder(json.JSONEncoder): """Wrapper class to handle decimal.Decimal objects in json.dumps().""" def default(self, obj): if isinstance(obj, decimal.Decimal): return float(obj) return super(DecimalJSONEncoder, self).default(obj) json.dumps(metadata, cls=DecimalJSONEncoder))

commit_message:
Fix get backup object

Method on_get returns list of backups, not a single backup.
This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: I50ae24b11b58bcea3d2c9f117957300a926cd3ab
Closes-Bug: #1646573
Signed-off-by: Ruslan Aliev <raliev@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
[mesos]remove redundant security group

This patch move security group out of mesos slave resource group.
Security group should only declear once, and use it for the rest part.
Closes-Bug: #1646676

Change-Id: I4ea5af1fda5eea452a21151daad5ec2815389824

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.

commit_message:
Add full pep8 check

This patch adds almost full pep8 check including unit test code.
All code style problems is solved.

Change-Id: Ie9b31b2ecfafc22fc299d749ca45ce69fdc64472
Closes-Bug: #1645342
Signed-off-by: Ruslan Aliev <raliev@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-freezerclient refs/changes/38/403738/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Ignored hackings: # H104 -> empty file, only comments # H202 -> assertRaises(Exception, ...) too broad # H404 -> Multi line docstrings should start without a leading new line. # H405 -> Multi line docstrings should start with a one line summary followed by an empty line. ignore = H104,H202,H404,H405exclude = .venv,.tox,dist,doc,*egg,releasenotes
deleted_lines: # it's not a bug that we aren't using all of hacking # H102 -> apache2 license exists # H103 -> license is apache # H201 -> no bare excepts # H501 -> don't use locals() for str formatting # H903 -> \n not \r\n ignore = H select = H102, H103, H201, H501, H903, H201, H306, H301, H233exclude = .venv,.tox,dist,doc,test,*egg,tests,releasenotes

commit_message:
Add CORS filter to versions pipeline

This patch exposes the root (version) resource to CORS-enabled
browser clients that wish to perform API version discovery.

This feature is required for js-openstack-lib, and its devstack
tests. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/370389/

Change-Id: I4052186bffa3bddb4d28e378e6a135694a71e05b
Needed-By: Ia19afa530ae8c2df60db740cec9267fe240978c0

import oslo_messaging as messaging from oslo_utils import importutilsosprofiler_notifier = importutils.try_import('osprofiler.notifier') profiler = importutils.try_import('osprofiler.profiler') osprofiler_web = importutils.try_import('osprofiler.web') profiler_opts = importutils.try_import('osprofiler.opts') if profiler_opts: profiler_opts.set_defaults(CONF) def setup_profiler(binary, host): if (osprofiler_notifier is None or profiler is None or osprofiler_web is None or profiler_opts is None): #LOG.debug('osprofiler is not present') return import pdb; pdb.set_trace() if CONF.profiler.enabled: connection_str = CONF.profiler.connection_string _notifier = osprofiler_notifier.create( connection_str, messaging=messaging, context={}, transport={}, project="sahara", service=binary, host=host) osprofiler_notifier.set(_notifier) osprofiler_web.enable(CONF.profiler.hmac_keys) """LOG.warning( _LW("OSProfiler is enabled.

commit_message:
[Docs] Exception for removing default accounts

Deployers must review the list of user accounts manually. This isn't possible
with automated tasks.

Implements: blueprint security-rhel7-stig
Change-Id: I943c62009548002938f9637048bd98f0057d8fb5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/15/405615/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: status: exception - manual intervention tag: authDeployers are strongly urged to review the list of user accounts on each server regularly. Evaluation of user accounts must be done on a case-by-case basis and the tasks in the security role are unable to determine which user accounts are valid. Deployers must complete this work manually.
deleted_lines: status: not implemented tag: miscThis STIG requirement is not yet implemented.

commit_message:
Add _member_ role to Swift operator list

Newly created users unable to interract with Swift by default,
to fix this, we need to add _member_ role to Swift operator list.

Change-Id: Ia4a2ab35efa0e4304b9aba39d59c643848aa123d
Closes-Bug: #1561241

subject: Gracefully handle empty modprobe.d directory
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-01 18:35:47.000000000', 'files': ['roles/parts/kvm/tasks/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/53910b078eaf400acb9e98fcfef9e9d0540f7ee1', 'message': 'Gracefully handle empty modprobe.d directory

If /etc/modprobe.d is empty, sed errors with "no input files" which
causes quickstart to fail.  Use -exec with find, instead of piping to
xargs, so sed is only executed if files are present.

Change-Id: I43add72d48621e6343301f50d7a9f36e994647a2
'}]
commit_message:
Gracefully handle empty modprobe.d directory

If /etc/modprobe.d is empty, sed errors with "no input files" which
causes quickstart to fail.  Use -exec with find, instead of piping to
xargs, so sed is only executed if files are present.

Change-Id: I43add72d48621e6343301f50d7a9f36e994647a2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/65/405565/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: shell: find /etc/modprobe.d/ -type f -exec sed -i '/^options kvm_intel/d;/^options kvm_amd/d' {} +
deleted_lines: shell: find /etc/modprobe.d/ -type f -print0| xargs -0 sed -i '/^options kvm_intel/d;/^options kvm_amd/d'

commit_message:
Avoid duplicated project_id when show network resources

Project_id appear twice when show network resources. This
patch check and not append if it already has one.

Change-Id: I744988f3f52d4a744e397a6a82fefdc4c17eacbf
Closes-Bug: #1636123
Partially-Implements: blueprint duplicated-project-id

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # lbaasv2 driver for MidoNet from oslo_log import helpers as log_helpers from oslo_log import log as logging from neutron_lbaas.drivers import driver_base LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class MidonetLoadbalancerDriver(driver_base.LoadBalancerBaseDriver): def __init__(self, plugin): super(MidonetLoadbalancerDriver, self).__init__(plugin) self.load_balancer = MidonetLoadBalancerManager(self) self.listener = MidonetListenerManager(self) self.pool = MidonetPoolManager(self) self.member = MidonetMemberManager(self) self.health_monitor = MidonetHealthMonitorManager(self) class MidonetLoadBalancerManager(driver_base.BaseLoadBalancerManager): @driver_base.driver_op @log_helpers.log_method_call def create(self, context, obj): pass @driver_base.driver_op @log_helpers.log_method_call def update(self, context, old_obj, obj): pass @driver_base.driver_op @log_helpers.log_method_call def delete(self, context, obj): pass class MidonetListenerManager(driver_base.BaseListenerManager): @driver_base.driver_op @log_helpers.log_method_call def create(self, context, obj): pass @driver_base.driver_op @log_helpers.log_method_call def update(self, context, old_obj, obj): pass @driver_base.driver_op @log_helpers.log_method_call def delete(self, context, obj): pass class MidonetPoolManager(driver_base.BasePoolManager): @driver_base.driver_op @log_helpers.log_method_call def create(self, context, obj): pass @driver_base.driver_op @log_helpers.log_method_call def update(self, context, old_obj, obj): pass @driver_base.driver_op @log_helpers.log_method_call def delete(self, context, obj): pass class MidonetMemberManager(driver_base.BaseMemberManager): @driver_base.driver_op @log_helpers.log_method_call def create(self, context, obj): pass @driver_base.driver_op @log_helpers.log_method_call def update(self, context, old_obj, obj): pass @driver_base.driver_op @log_helpers.log_method_call def delete(self, context, obj): pass class MidonetHealthMonitorManager(driver_base.BaseHealthMonitorManager): @driver_base.driver_op @log_helpers.log_method_call def create(self, context, obj): pass @driver_base.driver_op @log_helpers.log_method_call def update(self, context, old_obj, obj): pass @driver_base.driver_op @log_helpers.log_method_call def delete(self, context, obj): pass

subject: Retire openstack-ansible-pip_lock_down repository
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-05 06:33:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-pip_lock_down/commit/75615bf589d48851aa306cea458bc4f7f91106a4', 'message': "Retire openstack-ansible-pip_lock_down repository

The content from the openstack-ansible-pip_lock_down repository
is no longer needed.

This patch implements a partial retirement of the repository from gate
testing as per [1].

The partial retirement is due to the fact that this repository
is still used for stable/mitaka. Once stable/mitaka is EOL'd this
repository can go into full retirement.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

Change-Id: I209b24b6da76fb7106d79afa62b2acf001304cca

This patch implements a partial retirement of the repository from gate
testing as per [1].

The partial retirement is due to the fact that this repository
is still used for stable/mitaka. Once stable/mitaka is EOL'd this
repository can go into full retirement.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

Change-Id: I209b24b6da76fb7106d79afa62b2acf001304cca

commit_message:
Retire openstack-ansible-pip_lock_down repository

The content from the openstack-ansible-pip_lock_down repository
is no longer needed.

This patch implements the retirement of the repository from gate
testing as per [1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

Depends-On: I149cc7a5226c53fba89963129135f34ebebaaca0
Change-Id: I209b24b6da76fb7106d79afa62b2acf001304cca

commit_message:
[WIP] Ensure that the nova-conductor service always starts first

In any deployment/upgrade it is essential that nova-conductor
is the first to start/restart.

This patch ensures that all notifiers related to nova-conductor
are executed before all other nova services.

Change-Id: Iddfe00f0d226fcdf1c917ecdc94f2954f538a464

added_lines: - name: Flush handlers meta: flush_handlers when: > inventory_hostname in (groups['nova_conductor'] + groups['nova_scheduler'] + groups['nova_api_os_compute'] + groups['nova_api_metadata'] + groups['nova_console'] + groups['nova_cert'])

subject: Add specific support for automatic compute RPC pinning
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-09 05:13:13.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova/commit/cb578cf4f26d34743e83ff3dacaf41efff562be0', 'message': 'Add specific support for automatic compute RPC pinning

Upgrade levels for "compute" have been set to "auto". This
configures version locking on the RPC message queue
communications between the various Compute services to allow
live upgrading. While this alone does not give the nova role
"live upgrading" it does provide a safegaurd and step in that
direction.

Change-Id: Ie9ace080e38edfe07fd3929962e66f713c293227
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add specific support for automatic compute RPC pinning

Upgrade levels for "compute" have been set to "auto". This
configures version locking on the RPC message queue
communications between the various Compute services to allow
live upgrading. While this alone does not give the nova role
"live upgrading" it does provide a safegaurd and step in that
direction.

Change-Id: Ie9ace080e38edfe07fd3929962e66f713c293227
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Retire OSA pip_lock_down repository from Newton

The pip_lock_down repository is still used in Mitaka, but has
been retired from use in Newton.

This patch adds a skip for all jobs on the repository for any
branches except stable/mitaka, but still allows the noop/merge
jobs to ensure that we can merge the retirement notice patch.

The repository is also removed from check-requirements and
from being tested using xenial/centos.

Needed-By: I209b24b6da76fb7106d79afa62b2acf001304cca
Depends-On: Ic7ec16d40f28489cab2999b12d7454b7ee617c59
Change-Id: I149cc7a5226c53fba89963129135f34ebebaaca0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/66/382166/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Skip all jobs except the noop/merge jobs for the OpenStack-Ansible # pip_lock_down repository except when executed against stable/mitaka. # This repository is no longer used from Newton onwards. - name: ^gate-openstack-ansible-pip_lock_down-.*(?!(merge|noop)).*$ branch: ^(?!(stable/mitaka)).*$ - name: noop-jobs

commit_message:
[WIP] Implement JIT container creation

This patch aims to achieve the following:

- Implement just-in-time (JIT) container creation. Containers
  will only be created when the service playbook is executed.
- Reduce the number of container restarts during a deployment
  to a single restart. This reduces the chance of failure during
  a deployment.
- Provide the follow-on flexibility of implementing role-based
  LXC cache preparation.

Change-Id: I5a4c066f5aefab4f76cd89d177df1be65c46a51e

subject: Move container bind-mounts and command settings to the inventory
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 13:50:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/79b6aeb4a4687c26c0395e71e182baf070ffbaba', 'message': 'Move container bind-mounts and command settings to the inventory

To reduce the number of times a container is restarted during the
build process, this patch moves the bind-mount configuration and
rekated commands from the service playbooks to the inventory.

This ensures that the settings can be applied and the commands
executed when the container is created, rather than after the
fact. This, in turn, eliminates the need to restart the container
again and wait for SSH connectivity to be restored.

Some configurations and commands are left behind as they are
conditional on variable settings.

Depends-On: I2aa015a136d6efca501797430d82f1461c303edf
Depends-On: I4c95a231af3306c5010b168e7cc181deecf1a58d
Change-Id: Ie2a0528fbd56c8360dd679f55fb2047e0a061c31

commit_message:
Move container bind-mounts and command settings to the inventory

To reduce the number of times a container is restarted during the
build process, this patch moves the bind-mount configuration and
related commands from the service playbooks to the inventory.

This ensures that the settings can be applied and the commands
executed when the container is created, rather than after the
fact. This, in turn, eliminates the need to restart the container
again and wait for SSH connectivity to be restored.

Some configurations and commands are left behind as they are
conditional on variable settings.

Depends-On: I72cdc607d7b4364d78c840bf688e43e013f40709
Change-Id: Ie2a0528fbd56c8360dd679f55fb2047e0a061c31

commit_message:
Configure Apache ports using lineinfile

In order to allow multiple services to run on the same host
(when not using containers), this patch uses lineinfile
instead of a template to change the Apache listening ports.

commit_message:
Support multiple meter dispatchers in ceilometer config

Currently we only support one dispatcher at a time. But ceilometer
config supports dispatching data to multiple destinations at the
same time. Update the param to support this.

Change-Id: Ie7d854928513239a5903862623df12af1d02b642

commit_message:
Move nodes' fqdns to a map to remove clutter

There were several instances where the short-names/FQDNs where being
gotten in the same way in the role's templates. So this introduces a
mapping to get these values in order to reduce clutter.

Change-Id: Ie7df360bb69d56655f3e0fcbbf4d297db39b7a26

commit_message:
Optimized reconfigure action for glance

Change-Id: I89e30e8b87f24a621c521d915842a4af0042d6fe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/11/376011/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: --- - name: Ensuring the containers up kolla_docker: name: "{{ item.name }}" action: "get_container_state" register: container_state failed_when: container_state.Running == false when: inventory_hostname in groups[item.group] with_items: "{{ glance_service_groups }}" - include: config.yml - name: Check the configs command: docker exec {{ item.name }} /usr/local/bin/kolla_set_configs --check changed_when: false failed_when: false register: check_results when: inventory_hostname in groups[item.group] with_items: "{{ glance_service_groups }}" # NOTE(jeffrey4l): when config_strategy == 'COPY_ALWAYS' # and container env['KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY'] == 'COPY_ONCE', # just remove the container and start again - name: Containers config strategy kolla_docker: name: "{{ item.name }}" action: "get_container_env" register: container_envs when: inventory_hostname in groups[item.group] with_items: "{{ glance_service_groups }}" - name: Remove the containers kolla_docker: name: "{{ item[0]['name'] }}" action: "remove_container" register: remove_containers when: - inventory_hostname in groups[item[0]['group']] - config_strategy == "COPY_ONCE" or item[1]['KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY'] == 'COPY_ONCE' - item[2]['rc'] == 1 with_together: - "{{ glance_service_groups }}" - "{{ container_envs.results }}" - "{{ check_results.results }}" - include: bootstrap_service.yml - include: start.yml when: remove_containers.changed - name: Restart containers kolla_docker: name: "{{ item[0]['name'] }}" action: "restart_container" when: - inventory_hostname in groups[item[0]['group']] - config_strategy == 'COPY_ALWAYS' - item[1]['KOLLA_CONFIG_STRATEGY'] != 'COPY_ONCE' - item[2]['rc'] == 1 with_together: - "{{ glance_service_groups }}" - "{{ container_envs.results }}" - "{{ check_results.results }}"

datastore directory.

commit_message:
Use transient hostname for deployed servers

The name output returned by this template is expected to be the short
name rather than a FQDN.  Generally 'hostnamectl --static' returns a
FQDN and --transient will be the short name.

This change switches to using --transient and also simplifies the
script by dropping the unused outputs.

Change-Id: I19eaf9f66668f7e68765bad4018c0c60314f3f8f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/54/404954/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: host=$(hostnamectl --static) echo -n "$host " > $heat_outputs_path.hosts_entry host_ip=$(python -c "import socket; print socket.gethostbyname(\"$host\")") echo -n "$host_ip " >> $heat_outputs_path.hosts_entry echo >> $heat_outputs_path.hosts_entry cat $heat_outputs_path.hosts_entry echo -n $host_ip > $heat_outputs_path.ip_address cat $heat_outputs_path.ip_address - name: hosts_entry description: hosts_entry - name: ip_address description: ip_address value: {get_attr: [HostsEntryDeployment, hostname]} hosts_entry: value: {get_attr: [HostsEntryDeployment, hosts_entry]} ip_address: value: {get_attr: [HostsEntryDeployment, ip_address]}

subject: Remove previous KVM modprobe configs only if they exist
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 13:37:40.000000000', 'files': ['roles/parts/kvm/tasks/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/eda50774f4075d8c951bdb2970baa6a81d201ef2', 'message': 'Remove previous KVM modprobe configs only if they exist

The "Remove previous KVM modprobe configs" play pipes all files
in /etc/modprobe.d/ to sed. On a new OS install this directory
is empty and the pipe to sed can cause the playbook run to fail.
This change adds a check to verify there are files in the directory
before piping the list to sed so that the playbook does not fail
in that case.

Change-Id: I032fdbe2d3b24761eb02c40e4ff88bbd04f88829
Closes-Bug: 1647357
'}]
commit_message:
Remove previous KVM modprobe configs only if they exist

The "Remove previous KVM modprobe configs" play pipes all files
in /etc/modprobe.d/ to sed. On a new OS install this directory
is empty and the pipe to sed can cause the playbook run to fail.
This change adds a check to verify there are files in the directory
before piping the list to sed so that the playbook does not fail
in that case.

Change-Id: I032fdbe2d3b24761eb02c40e4ff88bbd04f88829
Closes-Bug: 1647357
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/63/406963/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Check for previous KVM modprobe configs find: paths=/etc/modprobe.d/ file_type=directory patterns="*" register: dir_files become: true when: dir_files.matched|int != 0

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/02d5de94ed29984bae9779c107a4af4c

Change-Id: I95c91d6d8d2883c4b3e570f3d96a2089a8dd73b6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-virtualbox refs/changes/74/403374/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
deployment-images.yaml: Validation checking existence of required images.

- validation checks whether required deployment images are available
- it takes place before deployment - if required images do not exist,
  overcloud could not be deployed

Change-Id: Ib3f26b7a09779cadc7b741541e820fdd53a62d34
Closes-Bug: #1631425
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-validations refs/changes/56/400256/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- - hosts: undercloud vars: metadata: name: Verify existence of introspection images. description: > Before introspection phase, introspection images provided by the rhosp-director-images package should exist. Otherwise, nodes will not be able to download images to run introspection. This validation checks that images bm-deploy-kernel and bm-deploy-ramdisk exist. groups: - pre-introspection tasks: - name: Store available images shell: openstack image list | awk '{ print $4 }' register: shell_result - name: Check for required images fail: msg="The image {{ item }} is missing." when: '"{{ item }}" not in "{{ shell_result.stdout }}"' with_items: - bm-deploy-kernel - bm-deploy-ramdisk

subject: Redirect ExtensionDescriptor to neutron-lib
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-26 02:54:10.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/extensions.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/8b0bdbea83b1890e82159e18710103905876e157', 'message': 'Redirect ExtensionDescriptor to neutron-lib

Preliminary step in adopting ExtensionDescriptor from neutron-lib.

This switches to using the ExtensionDescriptor class from
neutron-lib. In this step we provide a redirector so that subprojects
do not break. In follow-up patches, all subprojects will switch to
using neutron-lib directly, and then the redirector will be removed
from neutron core.

Change-Id: I5a111e0033e518e39b3042f047ee9eebba77a0d5

commit_message:
Redirect ExtensionDescriptor to neutron-lib

Preliminary step in adopting ExtensionDescriptor from neutron-lib.

This switches to using the ExtensionDescriptor class from
neutron-lib. In this step we provide a redirector so that subprojects
do not break. In follow-up patches, all subprojects will switch to
using neutron-lib directly, and then the redirector will be removed
from neutron core.

Change-Id: I5a111e0033e518e39b3042f047ee9eebba77a0d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/02/403302/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron_lib.api import extensions as api_extensions# Temporary redirector to prevent subprojects from breaking. # TODO(HenryG): Remove once all subprojects are patched. ExtensionDescriptor = api_extensions.ExtensionDescriptor
deleted_lines: @six.add_metaclass(abc.ABCMeta) class ExtensionDescriptor(object): """Base class that defines the contract for extensions.""" @abc.abstractmethod def get_name(self): """The name of the extension. e.g. 'Fox In Socks' """ @abc.abstractmethod def get_alias(self): """The alias for the extension. e.g. 'FOXNSOX' """ @abc.abstractmethod def get_description(self): """Friendly description for the extension. e.g. 'The Fox In Socks Extension' """ @abc.abstractmethod def get_updated(self): """The timestamp when the extension was last updated. e.g. '2011-01-22T13:25:27-06:00' """ # NOTE(justinsb): Not sure of the purpose of this is, vs the XML NS def get_resources(self): """List of extensions.ResourceExtension extension objects. Resources define new nouns, and are accessible through URLs. """ resources = [] return resources def get_actions(self): """List of extensions.ActionExtension extension objects. Actions are verbs callable from the API. """ actions = [] return actions def get_request_extensions(self): """List of extensions.RequestException extension objects. Request extensions are used to handle custom request data. """ request_exts = [] return request_exts def get_extended_resources(self, version): """Retrieve extended resources or attributes for core resources. Extended attributes are implemented by a core plugin similarly to the attributes defined in the core, and can appear in request and response messages. Their names are scoped with the extension's prefix. The core API version is passed to this function, which must return a map[<resource_name>][<attribute_name>][<attribute_property>] specifying the extended resource attribute properties required by that API version. Extension can add resources and their attr definitions too. The returned map can be integrated into RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP. """ return {} def get_plugin_interface(self): """Returns an abstract class which defines contract for the plugin. The abstract class should inherit from extensions.PluginInterface, Methods in this abstract class should be decorated as abstractmethod """ return None def get_required_extensions(self): """Returns a list of extensions to be processed before this one.""" return [] def get_optional_extensions(self): """Returns a list of extensions to be processed before this one. Unlike get_required_extensions. This will not fail the loading of the extension if one of these extensions is not present. This is useful for an extension that extends multiple resources across other extensions that should still work for the remaining extensions when one is missing. """ return [] def update_attributes_map(self, extended_attributes, extension_attrs_map=None): """Update attributes map for this extension. This is default method for extending an extension's attributes map. An extension can use this method and supplying its own resource attribute map in extension_attrs_map argument to extend all its attributes that needs to be extended. If an extension does not implement update_attributes_map, the method does nothing and just return. """ if not extension_attrs_map: return for resource, attrs in six.iteritems(extension_attrs_map): extended_attrs = extended_attributes.get(resource) if extended_attrs: attrs.update(extended_attrs) def get_pecan_resources(self): """List of PecanResourceExtension extension objects. Resources define new nouns, and are accessible through URLs. The controllers associated with each instance of extensions.ResourceExtension should be a subclass of neutron.pecan_wsgi.controllers.utils.NeutronPecanController. If a resource is defined in both get_resources and get_pecan_resources, the resource defined in get_pecan_resources will take precedence. """ return []

commit_message:
Add sleep(2) when try to delete a container

Even though in devstack this test pass successfully, the same
don't happen in HA deployment. It takes a few seconds to
synchronize the deletion of the objects between the controllers
in order to delete the container. Without this time this test
fails consistently in tripleo as you can see in the logs at
http://bit.ly/2gMDl8d.
Adding the sleep makes the HA proxy have enough time to sync
the deletion of the objects, and the container is deleted
successfully.

Change-Id: Ie0f192f81a8b40af80128dd42f75f9a7097633d9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/65/406965/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import time After delete all the objects from a container, it will wait 2 seconds before delete the container itself, in order to deployments using HA proxy sync the deletion properly, otherwise, the container might fail to be deleted because it's not empty. # sleep 2 seconds to sync the deletion of the objects # in HA deployment time.sleep(2)

commit_message:
migration: don't assume the mixin use provision

In 2ad571c8d7a7e1d8d18f7c5e97c564509fd34816 we have changed the backend
used to cleanup the ModelsMigrationsSync by the one from
oslo_db.sqlalchemy.provision.

But in ModelsMigrationsSync, nothing uses the provisioning system. The
engine can be created outside oslo.db. And oslo.db must must not assume
it have been created by the oslo_db.sqlalchemy.provision module.

For example, 2ad571c8d7a7e1d8d18f7c5e97c564509fd34816 have broken the
Gnocchi models migration test that creates the engine itself.

This change builds a new backend to cleanup all database objects.

Change-Id: Ie8c454528ce3aa816c04fbb4beb69f4b5ec57e9c
Closes-bug: #1647280
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db refs/changes/61/406861/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def db_drop_tables(self): """Called during teardown to drop all tables associated with this test It assumes the engine have been created with the 'provision' module. """ # drop all tables after a test run backend = provision.Backend.backend_for_database_type( self.get_engine().name) backend.drop_all_objects(self.get_engine()) self.addCleanup(self.db_drop_tables)
deleted_lines: import functools # drop all tables after a test run backend = provision.Backend.backend_for_database_type( self.get_engine().name) self.addCleanup(functools.partial(backend.drop_all_objects, self.get_engine()))

commit_message:
Fix get_schema() for Enum

The Enum field is a subclass of String. However, when dumping schema, it
was not dumping its data type so the schema dumped was useless. This
patch fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I373f13412003a68fa0207ba44658b96ed7dc46a0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects refs/changes/61/389061/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: schema = super(Enum, self).get_schema() schema['enum'] = self._valid_values return schema

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

We should avoid using six.iteritems/keys achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items/keys instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable.

In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3 and
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I8cdac1b75918094b9b3acbc65d53d231e86eca19

commit_message:
Using --strict and add priority for del_flows

When networking-sfc deletes its own flow rules, it could delete more
rules because of the ambiguity of the rules.
This will add precision deletion for SFC created OVS flow rules.
When using '--strict' on 'del-flows' in ovs_ofctl, 'priority' would be
the required parameter for matches.

Change-Id: I15155d497ef4ee18890cb6e595d6ebb44688634d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-sfc refs/changes/80/385580/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def delete_flows(self, **kwargs): # Run precision deletion with option --strict and priority flow_expr_arr = [] for key, value in six.iteritems(kwargs): if key == "proto": flow_expr_arr.append(value) else: flow_expr_arr.append("%s=%s" % (key, str(value))) flow_str = ','.join(flow_expr_arr) + '\n' if "priority" in flow_str: self.run_ofctl('%s-flows' % 'del', ['--strict', '-'], flow_str) else: self.run_ofctl('%s-flows' % 'del', ['-'], flow_str)

commit_message:
Check fuel version after setup and update master node

Patch adds a small check for the output of the
`fuel --fuel-version` command and compare it
with predefined FUEL_RELEASE_VERSION
after the master node setup.

Change-Id: I542dcccef1047745de80ae8399043d944b664e91
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/71/399471/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from proboscis.asserts import assert_equal def check_fuel_version(self): admin_ip = self.env.get_admin_node_ip() cmd = "fuel --fuel-version --json" output = self.ssh_manager.check_call(admin_ip, cmd).stdout_json fuel_release = output['release'] err_msg = "Fuel version should be `{}` but it is `{}`".format( settings.FUEL_RELEASE_VERSION, fuel_release) assert_equal(fuel_release, settings.FUEL_RELEASE_VERSION, err_msg) self.check_fuel_version()

Remove redundant parameters from event interface

The 'context' and 'entity' parameters are redundant because they are all
fields of an action object. This patch removes them.

partial-blueprint: generic-event

subject: parts/kvm: do not run sed on empty find results
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 11:57:14.000000000', 'files': ['roles/parts/kvm/tasks/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/5d751760ab868a72b8efc27a62fd21b2612b6e01', 'message': 'parts/kvm: do not run sed on empty find results

Without `-r` in xargs, sed gets to run at least once even if
/etc/modprobe.d does not contain any file, which results in a non-zero
return code for sed, failing the play.

Change-Id: I92ba763d6e4e7175d8c8ea2b532a68aa9bc66a8f
'}]
commit_message:
parts/kvm: do not run sed on empty find results

Without `-r` in xargs, sed gets to run at least once even if
/etc/modprobe.d does not contain any file, which results in a non-zero
return code for sed, failing the play.

Change-Id: I92ba763d6e4e7175d8c8ea2b532a68aa9bc66a8f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/08/406908/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: shell: find /etc/modprobe.d/ -type f -print0| xargs -r -0 sed -i '/^options kvm_intel/d;/^options kvm_amd/d'
deleted_lines: shell: find /etc/modprobe.d/ -type f -print0| xargs -0 sed -i '/^options kvm_intel/d;/^options kvm_amd/d'

commit_message:
Add test-config local.conf processing

We need a local.conf processing phase after every run phase which lets
us override config options after that point. We didn't explicitly
support this for test-config before, which broke some CI systems when
we moved tempest to use this later phase.

Closes-Bug: #1646391

Change-Id: I7d693afa19acf3e8231e84e45b7a868628ebdbc0

commit_message:
passlib call of encrypt() replaced by hash()

  * Fix passlib call of encrypt() which is replaced by hash() upstream
    (Closes: #846729).

commit_message:
Remove PLURALS

It's written to but never read from!

Related-Bug: #1642426

This patch is required by neutron-lib adoption because it is part of
rehoming neutron/api/v2/attributes.py. All subprojects that reference
PLURALS must be patched to remove the reference.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Ifdf29b8fc4c824c0ee840c4f51593a5aa8a22127

commit_message:
add option to list-deliverables to show items without a stable branch

list-deliverables is already able to focus on a series. Add a new option
to let it show only items that do not have a stable branch for that
series. This can take the place of some of the tracking we were doing on
the old dashboard.

Change-Id: I57a51b5de9cd289369330a42dbf15003bedac091
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
add a command to build the release dashboard

This new command will replace the one in the release-tools
repository. It uses the deliverable data for a series to produce a
dashboard for tracking the cycle-with-milestone releases so we can set
up a spreadsheet to collaborate on keeping track of those releases.

The old command included deliverables using other release models, but
those are less important/useful to track in this manner.

Change-Id: Ic613d65ae3d143cc910fec201205f1f84fde761c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/07/405607/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
if the team arg is None, set the team from the parsed data

When we query for all deliverables in a series without specifying a
team, the team value returned is None. When that's passed to
Deliverable(), we don't know who the real team is. Look it up in the
parsed data instead of reporting None.

Change-Id: Ifef19450b5393dbd3f0aedb500b7d3c06aa749d0
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/06/405606/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if self.team is None: self.team = data['team']

commit_message:
fix rst formatting in README

Somehow an earlier commit removed a lot of the indentation that made the
README actual readable. Restore it.

Change-Id: I53e9400c42bfd5f6d23250821b6821ce2c9c7148
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/54/405554/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * the series (Kilo, Liberty, etc.) * the release model being used * for each repository * the name (such as ``openstack/oslo.config``) * the hash of the commit to be tagged * highlights for the release notes email (optional) * the starting points of all branches We track this metadata for the history of all releases of the deliverable, so we can render a set of release history documentation. The file should be named based on the deliverable to be tagged, so releases for ``liberty`` from the ``openstack/oslo.config`` repository will have a file in ``openstack/releases`` called ``deliverables/liberty/oslo.config.yaml``. Releases of the same deliverable from the ``stable/kilo`` branch will be described by ``deliverables/kilo/oslo.config.yaml``. Deliverables File Schema ======================== The top level of a deliverable file is a mapping with keys: ``team`` The name of the team that owns the deliverable, as listed in the governance repository data files. The slug name of the launchpad project, suitable for use in URLs. The URL or URLs to the published release notes for the deliverable for the series. Deliverables contained a single repository should simply include the URL to the notes for that repository. Deliverables made up of multiple repositories should use a hash to map each repository name to its notes URL. Either ``yes`` or ``no``, indicating whether the release announcement should include the link to the package on PyPI. Defaults to ``no``. Identify the release model used by the deliverable. See the reference section of the documentation for descriptions of the valid models. Categorize the deliverable based on what it does. See the reference section of the documentation for descriptions of the valid deliverable types. Describe how to link to artifacts produced by the project. The default is ``tarball`. Valid values are: tarball Automatically generates links to version-specific files on tarballs.openstack.org. none Do not link to anything, just show the version number. Mapping of special settings to control the behavior for each repository, keyed by the repository name. A list of flags attached to the repository. This repository has no job for building an artifact, but should be tagged anyway. This repository is no longer used, but was present in old versions of a deliverable. This (optional) key sets the level of validation for the versions numbers. ``std`` Default: Enforces 3 digit semver version numbers in releases and allows for common alpha, beta and dev releases. This should be appropriate for most OpenStack release requirements. ``xstatic`` Allows a more flexible versioning in line with xstatic package guidelines and requirements. ``fuel`` The Fuel project manages its own packages. A list of the releases for the deliverable. A list of the branches for the deliverable. Each ``release`` entry is a mapping with keys: The version tag for that release, to be applied to all of the member projects. A list of all of the projects making up the deliverable for that release. An optional message to be included in the release note email announcing the release. (Use ``|`` to indicate a multi-line, pre-formatted message.) The name of the repository on git.openstack.org. The SHA1 hash for the commit to receive the version tag. An optional name for the base of the tarball created by the release. If no value is provided, it defaults to the repo base name. The name of the branch.

commit_message:
ignore launchpad connection errors

If we can't connect to the launchpad API, emit a warning but continue. 99%
of the time we don't need to check the launchpad name anyway, so failing
because LP is down is just frustrating and not useful to anyone.

Change-Id: I21b1b910894645ea1743c36bc1d92130cc92129e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/31/405631/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: lp_resp = requests.get('https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/' + lp_name) except requests.exceptions.ConnectionError as e: # The flakey Launchpad API failed. Don't punish the user for that. mk_warning('Could not verify launchpad project %s (%s)' % (lp_name, e)) else: if (lp_resp.status_code // 100) == 4: mk_error('Launchpad project %s does not exist' % lp_name)
deleted_lines: lp_resp = requests.get('https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/' + lp_name) if (lp_resp.status_code // 100) == 4: mk_error('Launchpad project %s does not exist' % lp_name)

commit_message:
only validate modified deliverable files

Early on when we only had a few deliverable files it was safe to apply
validation changes to all of the current release series. Now that is no
longer the case, because doing so takes far too much time and the jobs
fail regularly when there are so many repos to check.

We have unit tests for the validation rules now, so it is safer to make
changes. This commit changes the default behavior so that if the commit
under review has no deliverable files changed the validate job does
nothing.

Change-Id: I3ab4b71fb245661579cc528526b42f592ef32f7f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/68/405668/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: print('no modified deliverable files and no arguments, ' 'skipping validation') return 0
deleted_lines: print('no modified deliverable files, validating all releases from %s' % defaults.RELEASE) filenames = glob.glob('deliverables/' + defaults.RELEASE + '/*.yaml')

Show real error when it fails to create a new VBMC

Prior to this patch VBMC was logging the error code instead of the error
message when it failed to create a new VBMC.

Closes-Bug: #1647335

commit_message:
Don't validate address when using get_attr

We added bunch of validations for address property of monasca
notification resource. However, this would not work when we
use 'get_attr' with another resource(yet to be created), that
returns None.

Change-Id: Ic457ce343916e6a664dcfb497b42eaf47036b8b3
Closes-Bug: #1646633

commit_message:
Auto enable the deploy driver

This will reduce misconfiguration as if the user forgets to
include its driver in the enabled driver, the stack will fail.

Change-Id: If5275a93432ffcac350e8bffa1ad4a2b126eea56
